text: well what happened in Iraq was that a
vacuum was created and there are
probably a lot of reasons for that
primary reason is Prime Minister Maliki
who I think failed to really try to
bring that country together at the same
time combined with that I think is not
having a presence in Iraq and we had
planned to try to maintain a force of
eight to ten thousand US forces there
for the primary reason of supporting
their military to keep them in the right
direction support their intelligence
operations to keep them in the right
direction and I think to a large extent
keep pressure on Maliki to hopefully
stay in the right place so you know my
experience was that if you if you really
if we really leaned on him and made it
very clear and frankly we were providing
significant military aid or providing
f-16 fighters we were providing other
forms of military aid I think we could
have had the leverage to kind of push
him in the right direction so are you
saying then the President Obama's
failure to put pressure on Maliki to
keep ten thousand American forces in
Iraq has had a direct consequence today
of allowing Islamic state where I move
into the country it's it's difficult to
say what what history would have been
different suggesting that the American
forces might have stopped the situation
we have today I what I'm suggesting is
that we would at least have had a better
chance if somebody'd said to you a year
ago this is the situation we're going to
be in in Iraq now and Syria with Islamic
state would you have believed them I
would not have believed it would have
been as bad as it is I didn't believe
that the Sunnis would be as discouraged
as they are and that some of that
resulted in some of these foreign
fighters going into Syria and becoming
part of Isis and and I think it's fair
to say that although we knew that there
were extremists in Syria that they're
very few they kind of looked at Isis as
that larger threat that it became
in terms of invading Iraq you've run the
CIA you've run the Pentagon do you think
this is an enemy that America can defeat
I do i do I have tremendous confidence
in our ability to defeat Isis and I'll
tell you why because you know we
declared war against Al Qaeda after nine
eleven and this was a very similar kind
of enemy as fanatical and is dangerous
and terrorists as as Isis wasn't more I
think what's going to be needed here
though is a very long and sustained
effort this is going to be much longer
in terms of our ability to ultimately
disrupt and destroy them and it's going
to take time and that's going to be the
issue question that the American people
are going to have to face the question
the world is going to have to face in
terms of the coalition we've put
together is whether or not we will stick
with it and make sure that we that we
follow through and take this to the
final victory Leon Panetta thanks very
much
